content: urederra socks are an intermediate knitting level they are knit **cuff-down** in the round except the heel flap that is knit back and forth the pattern includes one schematics and written instructions for the schematics the **techniques** you need to know to knit this socks are magic loop twisted german cast on picking up stitches at the heel kitchener stitch in this design you will find 3 sizes to choose from they will appear as 1 2 3 and are equivalent to a foot circumference of 17 5 20 22 5 cm / 7 8 8 5 inches size 1 are written for 56 sts size 2 for 64 sts and size 3 for 72 sts **materials ** for this design i used 2 skeins of regia 4-fädig 4 ply it s a sock fingering weight yarn for size 2 and foot 39 i used 71 grams total the equivalent is a 100 grams and 400 metres skein of fingering weight yarn designed for socks **tools ** * 2 5 mm us 1½ needle or size needed to obtain gauge this pattern is written for circular needles with a 80 cm / 30 inches cable using the magic loop technique but it can be adapted to * 5 double pointed needles dpns * tiny circular needles with a 23 cm / 9 inches cable if you use this you will also need dpns or a long circular needle to work the toes * 1 border marker bm * 2 extra markers * tapestry needle * tape measure * scissors * row counter optional but recommended * sock blockers optional but recommended for a perfect finish once blocked
